remarks: The infimum of a subset of an upper set of integers is less than or equal to all members of the subset.  Note that the " ` ``' < ` " argument turns supremum into infimum (for which we do not currently have a separate notation).  (Contributed by NM, 11-Oct-2005.)
statement: infmssuzle $p |- ( ( S C_ ( ZZ>= ` M ) /\ A e. S ) -> sup ( S , RR , `' < ) <_ A ) $.
